sn4.17:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
sn4.17:4.2: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dharma talk on the topic of the six fields of contact.
sn4.17:4.3: And those mendicants were paying attention, focusing, concentrating, and listening well.
sn4.17:5.2: “This ascetic Gotama is educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dharma talk on the topic of the six fields of contact.
sn4.17:5.3: And those mendicants were paying attention, focusing, concentrating, and listening well.
sn4.17:5.4: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”
sn4.17:5.5: The Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha
sn4.17:5.6: and made a terrifyingly loud noise close by him. It seemed as if the earth was shattering.
sn4.17:5.7: Then one of the mendicants said to another:
sn4.17:5.8: “Mendicant, mendicant, it seems like the earth is shattering!”
sn4.17:5.9: When this was said, the Buddha said to that mendicant:
sn4.17:5.11: That’s Māra the Wicked come to pull the wool over your eyes!”
sn4.17:5.12: Then the Buddha, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, addressed him in verse:
